verses.text: And this \add is\add* the with which Moses, the man of God, blessed the children of Israel before his death.

And he said, the LORD came from Sinai, and rose up from Seir to them; he shined forth from mount Paran, and he came with ten thousands of saints: from his right hand \add went\add* a fiery law for them.
Yea, he loved the people; all his saints \add are\add* in thy hand: and they sat down at thy feet; \add every one\add* shall receive of thy words.
Moses commanded us a law; \add even\add* the inheritance of the congregation of Jacob.
And he was king in Jeshurun, when the heads of the people \add and\add* the tribes of Israel were assembled.
Let Reuben live, and not die; and let \add not\add* his men be few.

And this \add is the blessing\add* of Judah: and he said, Hear, LORD, the voice of Judah, and bring him to his people: let his hands be sufficient for him, and be thou a help \add to him\add* from his enemies.
And of Levi he said, \add Let\add* thy Thummim and thy Urim \add be\add* with thy holy one, whom thou didst prove at Massah, \add and with\add* whom thou didst strive at the waters of Meribah;
Who said to his father and to his mother, I have not seen him, neither did he acknowledge his brethren, nor know his own children: for they have observed thy word, and kept thy covenant.
They shall teach Jacob thy judgments, and Israel thy law; they shall put incense before thee, and whole burnt sacrifice upon thy altar.
Bless, LORD, his substance, and accept the work of his hands: smite through the loins of them that rise against him, and of them that hate him, that they rise not again.
\add And\add* of Benjamin he said, The beloved of the LORD shall dwell in safety by him; \add and the LORD\add* shall cover him all the day long, and he shall dwell between his shoulders.
And of Joseph he said, Blessed of the LORD \add be\add* his land, for the precious things of heaven, for the dew, and for the deep that coucheth beneath,
And for the precious fruits \add brought forth\add* by the sun, and for the precious things put forth by the moon,
And for the chief things of the ancient mountains, and for the precious things of the lasting hills,

And for the precious things of the earth and fullness of it, and \add for\add* the good will of him that dwelt in the bush; let \add the blessing\add* come upon the head of Joseph, and upon the top of the head of him that was separated from his brethren.

His glory \add is like\add* the firstling of his bullock, and his horns \add are like\add* the horns of unicorns: with them he shall push the people together to the ends of the earth: and they \add are\add* the ten thousands of Ephraim, and they \add are\add* the thousands of Manasseh.
And of Zebulun he said, Rejoice, Zebulun, in thy going out; and Issachar, in thy tents.
They shall call the people to the mountain; there they shall offer sacrifices of righteousness: for they shall suck \add of\add* the abundance of the seas, and \add of\add* treasures hid in the sand.
And of Gad he said: Blessed \add be\add* he that enlargeth Gad: he dwelleth as a lion, and teareth the arm with the crown of the head.

And he provided the first part for himself, because there, \add in\add* a portion of the lawgiver, \add was he\add* seated: and he came with the heads of the people, he executed the justice of the LORD, and his judgments with Israel.
And of Dan he said, Dan \add is\add* a lion's whelp: he shall leap from Bashan.
And of Naphtali he said, O Naphtali, satisfied with favor, and full with the blessing of the LORD: possess thou the west and the south.
And of Asher he said, \add Let\add* Asher \add be\add* blessed with children; let him be acceptable to his brethren, and let him dip his foot in oil.
Thy shoes \add shall be\add* iron and brass; and as thy days, \add so shall\add* thy strength \add be\add* .
\add There is\add* none like to the God of Jeshurun, \add who\add* rideth upon the heaven in thy help, and in his excellence on the sky.
The eternal God \add is thy\add* refuge, and underneath \add are\add* the everlasting arms: and he shall thrust out the enemy from before thee, and shall say, Destroy \add them\add* .
Israel then shall dwell in safety alone; the fountain of Jacob \add shall be\add* upon a land of corn and wine, also his heavens shall drop down dew.

Happy \add art\add* thou, O Israel: who \add is\add* like to thee, O people saved by the LORD, the shield of thy help, and who \add is\add* the sword of thy excellence! and thy enemies shall be found liars to thee; and thou shalt tread upon their high places.
